transcripts.text: A defined territory is crucial for the survival of an ethnic group.  The passionate relationship between a people and its homeland has been constant throughout history.  A people can suffer many setbacks, but as long as it retains its own territorial space, it can recover.

The most important principle that should guide us not only ideologically, but also strategically going forward, is the first principle, principle number one.  Because principle number one, it's about the reintegration of the national territory.  It's about that.  the National Party believes that the territory of Ireland consists of the whole island of Ireland, its islands and territorial seas.  But I want to say this to you, the National Party principle number one, The scope of that principle extends even beyond that wording.  It's not just about the territorial reunification of this country.  It's not just about the final ending of foreign British rule in the six counties of this country.  It's not just about that.  It's not just about taking back our fishing waters, re-establishing Irish sovereignty over the whole country.  It's about bringing about the unity of the Irish people.

The main reason that I became involved in the National Party was because I was heartened by the dedication of the people that I met at Barrow Street, the people that I met at Tuesla and at the various protests who were from the National Party.

This party is already not supposed to exist according to our enemies.  That's back when we thought they were more serious than the unicorn onesies.  We actually thought they were a little bit more serious when they threatened us first.  So we took those threats rather more seriously.  But one of the things they told us at the time that the National Party was found in June, in November of 2016, is that we would not exist for very long.  We are still here.
And we are stronger than we ever were before.

Most Western countries now follow a policy of multiculturalism, which is a construct whose credibility was dismissed long ago.  The one thing that we do know is that tribalism is endemic to our species.  History has proven that races and cultures have absolutely no interest in integration.  and the stark difference between communities only causes fear, distrust and violence.

If you want change and you can't affect it, what happens?  You get direct action, you get desperation, you get marching, you get all sorts of violence.  We in the National Party are not about that.  We're going to fight back, but we will do so in the political arena.

The penny has dropped with an awful lot of people who previously didn't seem to know what was happening or maybe they thought they were playing the cute game, letting other people put their necks on the line.  The problem is it isn't up to other people.  We have to make the move ourselves.
This country is all we have.  There is nowhere else.

Unity of the Irish people, I have to say, and we all know our history, that has been sadly lacking for too many centuries at this stage.  We're a great race of people, the Irish nation, but no race of people is without its flaws.  One flaw that must be overcome.  It is a flaw that has been exploited by others, that has enabled others to come over here and to conquer and to colonise and pillage and rape and steal and subjugate our country for centuries.  And that was division.  This country has been riven with division.  Not only the division, the physical division, but the territorial division between the 26 counties and the 6 counties.  The division between the green and the orange.  The divisions that occurred back in 1922 because of the treaty.  The divisions between people who have allowed establishment political parties, now globalist political parties, to use the mass media, to use the Griggs system, to manipulate public opinion, and we have people divided.
Diversity is not a strength.  In fact, it's the polar opposite.  Diversity and division are the same word.  It's hidden.  It's hidden in plain sight.
Division.  That's our flaw.  And the National Party is about correcting that flaw.  Because the National Party is about the national idea.
